item.title: Fortnite is Offering the Santa Dogg Skin for Free During Winterfest 2024
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/fortnite-is-offering-the-santa-dogg-skin-for-free-during-winterfest-2024/

Fortnite’s Winterfest event has kicked off with Mariah Carey, Santa Shaq and Santa Dogg making their way to the island. Fortnite is gifting players the Santa Dogg skin for free during this event. 

Free Santa Dogg Skin in Fortnite

With Winterfest 2024 kicking off, the Winterfest Cabin has returned too as a new tab on the home page. The Winterfest Cabin will provide players a new gift every day between December 20, 2024 and January 7, 2025. Players can get the Santa Dogg skin for free from one of these presents, along with other items such as Yulejacket Outfit, Peppermint Paraglider and more. The Fortnite Santa Dogg skin sees the popular West Coast rapper wear a Christmas-themed outfit.

The Santa Dogg x Fortnite collab extends to vehicles with the Cadillac Bundle. This paid bundle includes a 1966 Cadillac DeVille Car Body with the Snoop Wrapped Decal, three other decals, and SD Whitewall Wheels. Players will also find the Dogghouse Sleigh Emote alongside the bundle in the Item shop. 

Mariah Carey and Santa Shaq Have Arrived in Fortnite

The Mariah Carey Bundle and the Santa Shaq Bundle will be making their way to the Fortnite Item Shop as a part of Winterfest 2024. The Mariah Carey bundle will feature the Santa Suit Mariah Outfit and the gold Mariah Carey Outfit. Players will also receive Angelic Wings, Gilded Honey Wings Back Blings, Mariah’s Mic, and the All I Want For Christmas Are You Emote. 

Mariah Carey was indeed in the ice block, and now she has been freed. The singer now offers a Holiday Present to anyone who dances with her on the island.

The Santa Shaq Bundle, on the other hand, includes the Santa Shaq Outfit with a hood, beard, glasses, and hat that have individual toggles. The bundle also features Santa Shaqpack Back Bling, Hittin’ Mittens Pickaxe, Shaq Wrapped Wrap, and Nice List Emote. 

In other news, Renegade Raider has returned to Fortnite. Also, players are receiving their share of a $72 million refund from the game. What are your thoughts on the free Santa Dogg skin in Fortnite? Let us know in the comments or our community forum!

For more from Insider Gaming, read about Cloud Imperium Games going through a major shakeup to hit deadlines. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Evil Geniuses Sign yay and icy To Complete 2025 VALORANT Roster
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/evil-geniuses-sign-yay-and-icy-to-complete-2025-valorant-roster/

Evil Geniuses has officially signed Jaccob “yay” Whiteaker and Jacob “icy” Lange to its VALORANT roster today. The two players will join the returning trio Derrek “Derrek” Ha, Nicholas “NaturE” Garrison and Phat “Supamen” Le.

While EG took a step back in 2024 after its 2023 world championship, the organization has now brought in a player once recently regarded as VALORANT’s best duelist.

Someone Cooked Here

The addition of icy was announced earlier in the day. icy played for G2 during the 2024 season, helping the roster core that qualified through Ascension reach the playoffs of Champions 2024. Coincidentally, icy was dropped this offseason in favor of the last remaining EG player from their Champions 2023 run, Alexander “jawgemo” Mor. Icy was also on the EG reserve roster in 2023.

Yay competed as a stand-in for Evil Geniuses during this offseason at the Sen City Classic. EG also competed with Tyler “sym” Porter at that event, though he returned to TSM in Challengers. At the Sen City Classic, yay said that things were “clicking right away” as soon as he started playing with EG.

With icy arriving alongside him, yay will not take on the primary duelist role he was once famous for. Following the 2022 season, in which yay established himself as a world-class duelist player for OpTic, yay was highly sought after by all the partnered teams. He would land with Cloud9, but nothing went his way over the next two years. He quickly departed C9, had a dismal run with Disguised in NA Challengers, then found himself in the Pacific league with BLEED in 2024. 

BLEED was removed from the VALORANT Champions Tour by Riot completely, due to “failure to comply with critical reporting requirements and other key obligations under the TPA.” This was part of a much larger story at BLEED involving alleged missed payments and the CEO’s legal troubles.

Did Evil Geniuses put together a winning lineup with yay and icy? Let us know on the Insider Gaming forum.

For more of the latest esports news, stay tuned to Insider Gaming.
